alert.note: Alert for Irwin (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 02 at 9:13PM EST until January 06 at 11:30AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Georgia, including the following areas, Ben Hill, Irwin, Tift and Turner. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 913 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 3 Hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ocilla, Fitzgerald, Tifton, Omega, Ty Ty, Mystic, Unionville, Phillipsburg, Pinetta, Irwinville, Irwinville Airport, Fitzgerald Municipal A/P, Harding, Waterloo, Abba, Arp, Brookfield, Vanceville, Lulaville and Chula. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
